abstracts.cdata!:
The Primary Education Project in
            Pakistan was achieved. The Borrower did not have the
            manpower to provide the needed service. Therefore, the
            involvement of the Bank Resident Mission personnel in
            project monitoring was an effective measure and should be
            continued and strengthened. The major issues of conflict
            were: (i) the Government was not clear on the actual needs
            for technical assistance and was quite concerned about its
            quality and nature, since the contract was in such general
            terms that no one was able to fully understand what It
            really Implied; (ii) some consultants arrived late and had
            not been properly briefed and therefore did not understand
            the nature of the project. It seems clear therefore that the
            overall performance of the project provided sufficient
            evidence to warrant the encouragement to use a balanced team
            of expatriate and national consultants in a follow-on
            project, but under clearly defined conditions This would
            entail a clear dialogue and mutual understanding between
            both parties with the view to avoiding all constraining
            elements as those (and any other) confronted in this project.
